easy.question: What is the capital of France?
What is the primary language for web pages?
Which of these is an operating system?
Which planet is known as the 'Red Planet'?
What is the largest ocean on Earth?
What do you call a baby dog?

medium.question: Which data structure uses LIFO order?
In object-oriented programming, what is encapsulation?
options: The process of creating new objects
Bundling data and methods that operate on the data within a single unit
Hiding the implementation details of a class
The ability of an object to take on many forms
medium.answer: Bundling data and methods that operate on the data within a single unit

medium.question: Which of these is a common sorting algorithm?
What is the purpose of CSS in web development?
options: To define the structure of a web page
To add interactivity to a web page
To style the visual presentation of a web page
medium.answer: To style the visual presentation of a web page

medium.question: Which of the following is a non-relational database?
Which of these is a version control system?
What is the main function of a router in a network?
options: To connect devices within a local area network
To forward data packets between computer networks
medium.answer: To forward data packets between computer networks

hard.question: What is a perceptron in machine learning?
Which algorithm is used for shortest path in graphs?
What is the purpose of a 'JOIN' clause in SQL?
options: To combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them
To filter rows based on a condition
To group rows that have the same values in specified columns into a summary row
To sort the result-set of a query
hard.answer: To combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them

hard.question: In the context of concurrent programming, what is a 'deadlock'?
options: A state where a program has crashed
A situation where two or more competing actions are each waiting for the other to finish
hard.answer: A situation where two or more competing actions are each waiting for the other to finish

hard.question: What is the time complexity of searching in a balanced binary search tree?
Which of the following is a characteristic of a pure function in functional programming?
options: It always produces the same output for the same input and has no side effects
hard.answer: It always produces the same output for the same input and has no side effects

hard.question: What is the CAP theorem in distributed systems?
What is the purpose of a 'hash function' in data structures?
options: To map data of arbitrary size to data of a fixed size
To search for data in linear time
hard.answer: To map data of arbitrary size to data of a fixed size

hard.question: In computer security, what is a 'man-in-the-middle' attack?
options: An attack that floods a server with traffic
An attack where the attacker secretly relays and possibly alters the communication between two parties who believe they are directly communicating
An attack that injects malicious code into a website
An attack that exploits a software vulnerability
hard.answer: An attack where the attacker secretly relays and possibly alters the communication between two parties who believe they are directly communicating

hard.question: What is the 'Halting Problem' in computability theory?
options: The problem of determining if a program will ever stop running or continue to run forever
The problem of optimizing program execution speed
The problem of converting assembly code to machine code
The problem of debugging a program
hard.answer: The problem of determining if a program will ever stop running or continue to run forever
